snippet: Cuts in a federal energy-assistance program have left some families struggling to pay for oil to heat their homes.
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column asserts that cuts in a federal energy-assistance program have left some families in Maine struggling to pay for oil to heat their homes; notes reduced assistance is meant to wean rural consumers off of messy and expensive heating oil, but many residents cannot afford to switch to a cleaner heat source.
lead_paragraph: Cuts in a federal energy-assistance program have left some families struggling to pay for oil to heat their homes.

headline.print_headline: In Fuel Oil Country, Cold That Cuts to the Heart
headline.seo: Maine Residents Struggle to Heat Their Homes
headline.main: In Fuel Oil Country, Cold That Cuts to the Heart
